Description: Fragment of East Greek black-figured pottery open vase, probably a bowl. Inside streakily glazed; on the exterior, foreleg and part of body of animal to right; swastika filling ornament between legs; where the glaze has peeled the surface appears white.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Venit misreads the surface as added white. Incision seems assured for details of the animal.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 57, no. 201 pl. 47)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 259)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1181)
